isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Cylinder Head Bolt Torque Sequence

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use a permanent ink marker to identify head bolt torque orientation. Do not use paint or other temporary marking.
To prevent engine damage, check to make sure all push rods have been seated in their respective rocker arm pivot recesses.

To prevent engine damage, all M14 x 193 head bolts must be replaced when installing cylinder head. Lubricate bolt threads, flanges, and mating surfaces with a light coat of clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give an incorrect torque reading. Do not use anti-seize compound, grease, or any other lubricant on cylinder head bolt threads.

step1.para: Lightly lubricate new M14 x 193 cylinder head bolts with clean engine oil.
Install eight M14 head bolts in the head and finger tighten.
Tighten M14 bolts 1 through 8 in sequence to 88 N·m (65 lbf·ft).
Tighten M14 bolts 1, 3, 5, and 7 in sequence to 116 N·m (85 lbf·ft).
Tighten M14 bolts 2, 4, 6, and 8 in sequence to 116 N·m (85 lbf·ft).
Tighten M14 bolts 1 through 8 in sequence clockwise 90 degrees.
Tighten M14 bolts 1 through 8 in sequence a second time clockwise 90 degrees.
Tighten M 14 bolts 1 through 8 in sequence a third time clockwise 90 degrees.
Tighten M8 x 70 bolts 9 through 12 in sequence to 24 N·m (18 lbf·ft).
Tighten M8 x 70 bolts 9 through 12 in sequence to 31 N·m (23 lbf·ft).
